pli-tv-bu-vb-sk25:2.1: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk25:5.1: 25. The training rule on squatting on the heels
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk25:6.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk25:6.2: At that time the monks from the group of six were squatting on their heels while walking in inhabited areas. …
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk25:7.1: “‘I will not squat on my heels while walking in inhabited areas,’ this is how you should train.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk25:8.1: Walking in an inhabited area, one should not squat on one’s heels.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk25:8.2: If a monk, out of disrespect, squats on his heels while walking in an inhabited area, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk25:9.2): if it is unintentional; if he is not mindful; if he does not know; if he is sick; if there are dangers; if he is insane;
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk25:9.2: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk25:10.1: The fifth training rule is finished.
